_comment_security: ⚠️ SECURITY WARNING: Never put API keys, tokens, or secrets in this configuration file!
_comment_secrets: Use environment variables for sensitive data instead of hardcoding them here
_comment_paths: ⚠️ IMPORTANT: Replace /ABSOLUTE/PATH/... placeholders with actual absolute paths on your system
_comment_no_shell_expansion: Note: $HOME and other shell variables do NOT expand in JSON config - use absolute paths
_comment_example_env_vars: For custom servers needing secrets, use: 'env': { 'API_KEY': '${API_KEY}' }
_comment_connectors: For GitHub, Notion, Zapier, etc., you can use either Connectors (UI) or MCP servers (JSON config)
_comment_connectors_ui: Connectors UI: Claude Desktop → Settings → Connectors (simpler for many services)
_comment_mcp_servers: MCP servers: Configured here in JSON (more control, reproducible)
_comment_github_options: GitHub: Use Connector for simplicity, or MCP server for custom tooling - see https://github.com/github/github-mcp-server
_comment_deny_lists: Always use deny lists to protect sensitive files like .env, credentials, SSH keys
_comment_least_privilege: Only grant MCPs the minimum access they need - restrict filesystem paths to specific directories
_comment_minimal_config: This is a minimal safe example - only add MCPs you actually need
_comment_before_committing: Before committing this file to version control, ensure no secrets are present!
_comment_version_control: Consider adding claude_desktop_config.json to .gitignore if it contains environment-specific paths
